title: U.S. Women’s Soccer Team Court Filings Show Pay for Top Players
text:
The U.S. Soccer Federation, defending itself against a gender discrimination suit from the U.S. women’s soccer team, last week submitted court filings asserting that four U.S. women’s national team players were paid more than the highest-earning player on the U.S. men’s team over a period of about six years.

On Monday, the women’s team responded in a filing that says there’s a reason for that: The women played many more games than the men and won more, including prevailing in two World Cups. The men reached the round of 16...
description: The U.S. Soccer Federation says top women were paid more than men. The women’s team responded in a filing that says there’s a reason: The women played many more games than the men and won more.
